subsection_name: viem-tuyen-tien-liet.json_4_Who is at risk of prostatitis?
subsection_content:
Risk factors for prostatitis in men recommended by urologists include:
Age: Young or middle-aged male over 50; History of prostatitis; People who have had urinary tract or genital infections; People with Immune Deficiency Syndrome (HIV/AIDS); Catheters to diagnose and treat urinary tract diseases; People who have had a biopsy to diagnose cancer risk; People who drink less water cause less urine to be expelled, causing bacteria to remain; People often become dehydrated due to work characteristics, illness, etc.; People doing jobs often experience shaking and concussion
Additional risk factors for prostatitis may include: psychological pressure, people who have had nerve damage in the pelvic area due to surgery or injury from exercise, etc.
In addition, people with phimosis or at risk of urinary tract infections are also more susceptible to prostatitis than others.
